title: expectRevert fails on internal calls (jumps) if public calls are performed first

body:
I ended up wrapping all my libs in my test files by doing the following in each test file:

1. Create an abstract `LibWrapper` contract at the top of the test file.
2. Expose `external` only methods that are wrapping my library internal methods (NOTE: some of the methods of the libs are taking storage references as params, for them I had to basically change the external interface to take the mapping key most of the time) with the following convention: `<method_name>_wrapper`.
3. Have my `TestContract` inherit my `LibWrapper`.
4. In my tests, replace all `Library.method()` calls to `this.method_wrapper()`.

All in all this is pretty repetitive but at the same time pretty easy to implement so maybe not that bad.

I have to say that I like @MathisGD idea a lot. But it kind of depend I guess if `testFail` was supposed to be deprecated or not in the future.

PS: Although having a `testFail` as described by @MathisGD might do the job for errors, wrapping libs would still be necessary when expecting events.
Closing as not a bug—but the convo here is valuable!
